content: When I think of States in trouble because of stupid financial mistakes, California and New York come to mind right away. To prove my case, New York is now forwarding a bill to raise taxes on Millionaires that live in their state. A Millionaires sur charge if you will. Some of these Millionaires like Rush and Donald Trump are moving out of New York because of it. Both already pay millions of dollars in State taxes and refuse to pay more based on the fact that they sleep in NY a few weeks out of the year. If they move out of New York the State will lose millions and more folks will lose jobs. All I can say to the Governor and Mayor of New York is this. "Your idiots".

content: Just as soon as Obama starts taxing those who make more than $250.000 a year his popularity will start to go south and then he will be out of there. content: I live in California and I admit we have lost it here. I also heard Trump is moving out of NY. I know he has been pretty upset that the banks would not loan him that money now that he was able to get that golf corse land in Scotland. He was on TV saying the banks were using that money to buy up other smaller banks in China of all places and he wanted to know what that was doing for the people of the US or something like that. I one read the most millionairs live in Dallas Texas, not sure if that is true or not. As for Obama and the $250,000 or up tax, that does not seem like the ultra rich these days. Plus, don't you think it stops people from wanting to do better and earn more? Will it keep people just flying under the radar?
reply: I live in California and I admit we have lost it here. I also heard Trump is moving out of NY. Nevertheless, much of our financial woes is due to the cuts in the income tax, and the corresponding HIKE in such taxes as Sales, property, etc, etc, which fall most heavily on the Middle Income/Middle Class. Now their proposing a tax on non diet soda, and tolls on intra-city bridges (That last would cost someone like me an additional $1200, minimum). And plenty of wealthy people here also do buisness here - They are in fact LESS mobile then I am - But their sure going to find it interesting when all their valuble employee's head for the hills. Dave

content: Well, there's this information: ""http://www.brillig.com/debt_clock/faq.html and this wiki discussion: ""http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:United_States_public_debt What we are spending today is completely out of control. Worse, the "Stimulus Bill" will not stimulate the actual engine of the economy, PRIVATE CAPITALISM. Capitalism gives the money multiplication , money as medium of exchange, effect that can return the exponential growth to the economy. We MUST STOP throwing away money at increasing government as it will DELAY and DELAY economic recovery.
reply: Well, there's this information: ""http://www.brillig.com/debt_clock/faq.html and this wiki discussion: ""http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:United_States_public_debt What we are spending today is completely out of control. content: quote: Originally posted by peter3_1: Well, there's this information: ""http://www.brillig.com/debt_clock/faq.html and this wiki discussion: ""http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:United_States_public_debt What we are spending today is completely out of control. Worse, the "Stimulus Bill" will not stimulate the actual engine of the economy, PRIVATE CAPITALISM. Capitalism gives the money multiplication , money as medium of exchange, effect that can return the exponential growth to the economy. We MUST STOP throwing away money at increasing government as it will DELAY and DELAY economic recovery. Personally, I have no problem with government action. None of our infrastructure would have been built without government action, and this goes back to the Eire Canal, or the building of our first railroad system over 150 years ago. Private Capital is unable to to this and was NEVER able to do this. My problems with this stimulous bill is that the majority of it is not "aimed" and "focused." Some of it is specifically aimed at creating a new modern rail system - Which is something we must have to remain a modern nation. But far to much of it is simply being tossed at items which are hit and miss, good and bad - Not an organised approach. And quite a bit of it is aimed at bailing out Capitalists whose greed brought about their own downfall. These banks should not be bailed out, rather they should be nationalised - bought at their true value, capitalised, and and give loans to honest productive companies, and individuals. Once the crisis is over they can be resold in the private market at a profit, and the taxpayer loses nothing; in fact makes a profit, and instead of adding to the deficit, will actually reduce the deficit. The Obama plan is actually a Republican style plan which bails out failed Capitalists, while not doing what government is supposed to do - Build an infrastructure for the 21st century. Dave
quote: Originally posted by peter3_1: Well, there's this information: ""http://www.brillig.com/debt_clock/faq.html and this wiki discussion: ""http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:United_States_public_debt What we are spending today is completely out of control. reply: Personally, I have no problem with government action. None of our infrastructure would have been built without government action, and this goes back to the Eire Canal, or the building of our first railroad system over 150 years ago. Private Capital is unable to to this and was NEVER able to do this. My problems with this stimulous bill is that the majority of it is not "aimed" and "focused." Some of it is specifically aimed at creating a new modern rail system - Which is something we must have to remain a modern nation. But far to much of it is simply being tossed at items which are hit and miss, good and bad - Not an organised approach. And quite a bit of it is aimed at bailing out Capitalists whose greed brought about their own downfall. These banks should not be bailed out, rather they should be nationalised - bought at their true value, capitalised, and and give loans to honest productive companies, and individuals. Once the crisis is over they can be resold in the private market at a profit, and the taxpayer loses nothing; in fact makes a profit, and instead of adding to the deficit, will actually reduce the deficit. The Obama plan is actually a Republican style plan which bails out failed Capitalists, while not doing what government is supposed to do - Build an infrastructure for the 21st century. Dave

I one read the most millionairs live in Dallas Texas, not sure if that is true or not. As for Obama and the $250,000 or up tax, that does not seem like the ultra rich these days. Plus, don't you think it stops people from wanting to do better and earn more? Will it keep people just flying under the radar?

Now their proposing a tax on non diet soda, and tolls on intra-city bridges (That last would cost someone like me an additional $1200, minimum). Now it may very well be that the wealthy are more mobile then I am - The difference however is that I will HAVE to leave in order to eat, while the wealthy will find an additional tax a minor matter. And plenty of wealthy people here also do buisness here - They are in fact LESS mobile then I am - But their sure going to find it interesting when all their valuble employee's head for the hills. Dave

content: Well, there's this information: ""http://www.brillig.com/debt_clock/faq.html and this wiki discussion: ""http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:United_States_public_debt What we are spending today is completely out of control. Worse, the "Stimulus Bill" will not stimulate the actual engine of the economy, PRIVATE CAPITALISM. Capitalism gives the money multiplication , money as medium of exchange, effect that can return the exponential growth to the economy. We MUST STOP throwing away money at increasing government as it will DELAY and DELAY economic recovery.
reply: Well, there's this information: ""http://www.brillig.com/debt_clock/faq.html and this wiki discussion: ""http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:United_States_public_debt What we are spending today is completely out of control. title: New York is as dumb as California.

content: quote: Originally posted by peter3_1: Well, there's this information: ""http://www.brillig.com/debt_clock/faq.html and this wiki discussion: ""http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:United_States_public_debt What we are spending today is completely out of control. Worse, the "Stimulus Bill" will not stimulate the actual engine of the economy, PRIVATE CAPITALISM. Capitalism gives the money multiplication , money as medium of exchange, effect that can return the exponential growth to the economy. We MUST STOP throwing away money at increasing government as it will DELAY and DELAY economic recovery. Personally, I have no problem with government action. None of our infrastructure would have been built without government action, and this goes back to the Eire Canal, or the building of our first railroad system over 150 years ago. Private Capital is unable to to this and was NEVER able to do this. My problems with this stimulous bill is that the majority of it is not "aimed" and "focused." Some of it is specifically aimed at creating a new modern rail system - Which is something we must have to remain a modern nation. But far to much of it is simply being tossed at items which are hit and miss, good and bad - Not an organised approach. And quite a bit of it is aimed at bailing out Capitalists whose greed brought about their own downfall. These banks should not be bailed out, rather they should be nationalised - bought at their true value, capitalised, and and give loans to honest productive companies, and individuals. Once the crisis is over they can be resold in the private market at a profit, and the taxpayer loses nothing; in fact makes a profit, and instead of adding to the deficit, will actually reduce the deficit. The Obama plan is actually a Republican style plan which bails out failed Capitalists, while not doing what government is supposed to do - Build an infrastructure for the 21st century. Dave

Some of it is specifically aimed at creating a new modern rail system - Which is something we must have to remain a modern nation. But far to much of it is simply being tossed at items which are hit and miss, good and bad - Not an organised approach. And quite a bit of it is aimed at bailing out Capitalists whose greed brought about their own downfall. These banks should not be bailed out, rather they should be nationalised - bought at their true value, capitalised, and and give loans to honest productive companies, and individuals. Once the crisis is over they can be resold in the private market at a profit, and the taxpayer loses nothing; in fact makes a profit, and instead of adding to the deficit, will actually reduce the deficit. I remember being surprised about those remarks, but he's repeated them a number of times. At least he realises that you can't squeeze blood from a stone... Dave
